abstract: When a UPS delivery worker shows up at your house, the bulky handheld that he yanks out for you to write your digital signature is known as a "rugged device." Microsoft's older Windows Mobile operating system is running on the vast majority of these devices, and it's questionable how long the software giant can fend off competitors offering alternatives on newer software.
lead_paragraph: When a UPS delivery worker shows up at your house, the bulky handheld that he yanks out for you to write your digital signature is known as a "rugged device." Microsoft's older Windows Mobile operating system is running on the vast majority of these devices, but competitors are offering rugged alternatives on newer software, and it's questionable how long Microsoft can fend them off.

headline.main: How Microsoft Could Lose Its Grip on 'Rugged' Devices
